description: The Senate confirmed Jack Lew as U.S. ambassador to Israel after months of back and forth amid the nation's war with Hamas.
maintext:
The Senate confirmed Jack Lew as U.S. ambassador to Israel after months of back and forth amid the nation's war with Hamas.
The vote was 53 to 43, with two Republicans, Sens. Rand Paul, Ky., and Lindsey Graham, S.C., joining all present Democrats in voting for him.
The US has been without an ambassador to its top ally in the Middle East since July when Tom Nides returned to the states to work at Wells Fargo.
Chargé d’affaires Stephanie Hallett has been managing US interests in Israel, at a time when the nation is locked into a war with Hamas in neighboring Gaza.
Biden and Secretary of State Antony Blinken have been in frequent contact with their Israeli counterparts, with Blinken and Biden traveling to Israel earlier this month.
The Senate confirmed Jack Lew as U.S. ambassador to Israel after months of back and forth amid the nation's war with Hamas
Lew serviced as director of the Office of Management and Budget under Presidents Bill Clinton and Barack Obama and was also Obama's chief of staff and Treasury secretary.
Lew is an Orthodox Jew who acted as a go-between for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Obama. He faced criticisms from Republicans over his involvement in the 2015 Iran deal to ease economic sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program.
Hamas' October 7 attack on Israel came at a time when there was no US ambassador in place in Israel, Egypt, Kuwait, Lebanon or Oman.
The US Agency for International Development (USAID) has been without an assistant administrator for the Middle East for over three years. The State Department’s role for coordinator for counterterrorism, who leads efforts to fight terrorism overseas, has been vacant for two years.
Lew was grilled over his role in the 2015 nuclear deal as Treasury secretary during his confirmation hearing.
"I want to be clear, Iran is a threat to regional stability and to Israel's existence," he insisted at the time.
Lew added that now is not the moment to restart a nuclear deal with the country, which provides weapons and funding to Hamas.
'I believe deeply that an agreement to not have nuclear weapons would be a good thing. But this is not the moment,' he said.
Meanwhile Israel's Defense Force is pushing deeper into Gaza in its bloody campaign to eradicate Hamas and end its 16-year rule over the Palestinian territory after an October 7 attack that killed some 1,400 Israelis.
Smoke rises from inside Northern Gaza on October 31, 2023 as seen from Sderot, Israel. As Israel's response to Hamas's Oct 7 attacks entered its fourth week
IDF ground forces and tanks operating in Gaza in undated footage. The footage was released by IDF on Tuesday, Oct. 31, 2023
The Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has rejected calls for a cease fire as airstrikes land near hospitals where thousands of Palestinians shelter beside the wounded. Tanks and other armored vehicles are pushing into the territory and according to the Palestinian Health Ministry some 8,000 Gaza residents have been killed.
Hamas is believed to be holding around 240 captives. The militant group has released four hostages and has said it would let the others go in return for thousands of Palestinian prisoners held by Israel.
Congress is now under pressure to pass Israel aid. The White House has requested a $100 billion package that includes aid for Israel, Ukraine and Taiwan.
But the House has proposed a $14 billion bill that offers aid to only Israel. That funding would be offset by taking it from additional IRS funding that was included in the Democrat-passed Inflation Reduction Act.
The House bills is unlikely to find an appetite in the Senate, but Speaker Mike Johnson has insisted Israel funding must be offset and stand alone.
title: Senate confirms Biden's controversial ambassador to Israel pick Jack Lew despite Republican concerns that he's 'pro-Iran'
